definition: to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished
to extinguish/to put out (fire)/to quench/to stop burning/to go out (of fire, lamp etc)/to come to an end/to wither away/to die out/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown

sentences.english: No longer would his darling’s candle be extinguished by his useless tears.
sentences.chinese: 宝贝女儿的蜡烛再也没有被他无用的眼泪熄灭过。

sentences.english: The play went on until the candles went out.
And slowly the kind man comes closer loses his rage sits down at table.
sentences.chinese: 那个和蔼的男人走近了，熄灭怒火在桌子旁坐下来。

sentences.english: An air-raid alarm sounded in the depths of night.
sentences.chinese: 空袭警报响时，城市的灯光就熄灭了。

sentences.english: At the same time that albumin and fetoprotein synthesis is extinguished.
sentences.chinese: 同时白蛋白和甲胎蛋白的合成被熄灭。

sentences.english: The radio's dial twirled and the lights behind the tuning panel went out.
sentences.chinese: 收音机的调谐钮转动了一下，面板上的指示灯熄灭了。

sentences.english: He snuffs out candle by his place, light fades out.
sentences.chinese: 他熄灭他身旁的蜡烛，光线渐暗。

sentences.english: Q is for Queching not, our spirits fan to flame.
sentences.chinese: 是不可熄灭，我的灵要如火挑旺起来。

sentences.english: The timed light always goes out before I can reach the landing.
sentences.chinese: 定时感应灯通常还没等我走到楼下就熄灭了。

sentences.english: She said the fire’d go out and her jars would break .
sentences.chinese: 她说炉火会熄灭的，她的罐子就会冻破。

sentences.english: We stay in the room, door closed, lights out.
sentences.chinese: 我们蛰伏在房间里，门关闭着，灯熄灭了。

sentences.english: But who can describe the thousand means of extinguishing the moccoletto?
sentences.chinese: 但谁能列举出那成千上万种熄灭长生烛的方法呢？

sentences.english: Here the socket of the candle dropped, and the wick went out.
sentences.chinese: 这时残烛落入了烛台孔中，烛芯熄灭了。

sentences.english: At the end of the poem, the embers of my fire are about to be snuffed out.
sentences.chinese: 在诗的结尾，我生命之火的余烬即将熄灭。

sentences.english: The soldier hastily butted his cigarette and came to attention.
sentences.chinese: 那个士兵匆匆地熄灭香烟，立正。

sentences.english: So presently the light was turned out and for some time there was quietness in the room.
sentences.chinese: 于是迅速地把灯熄灭，然后房间里是片刻的寂静。

definition: to extinguish/to put out (fire)/to quench/to stop burning/to go out (of fire, lamp etc)/to come to an end/to wither away/to die out/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes, controversy, flames of revolution)
tinder/source of a fire/inflammable material/(fig.) spark (of a revolution etc)
to illuminate/to turn on the lights/to light (a blaze)
